name: Jesus Crist Fully Man Fully God

verses.esv: 14 And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we have seen his glory, glory as of the only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth.
verses.kjv: 14 And the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us, (and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father,) full of grace and truth.
verses.niv: 14 The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us. We have seen his glory, the glory of the One and Only, who came from the Father, full of grace and truth.

verses.esv: 5 For there is one God, and there is one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus,
verses.kjv: 5 For there is one God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus;
verses.niv: 5 For there is one God and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus,

verses.esv: 9 For in him the whole fullness of deity dwells bodily,
verses.kjv: 9 For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily.
verses.niv: 9 For in Christ all the fullness of the Deity lives in bodily form,

verses.esv: 7 but emptied himself, by taking the form of a servant, being born in the likeness of men.
verses.kjv: 7 But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:
verses.niv: 7 but made himself nothing, taking the very nature of a servant, being made in human likeness.

verses.esv: 1:1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
verses.kjv: 1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
verses.niv: 1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

verses.esv: 58 Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, before Abraham was, I am.”
verses.kjv: 58 Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.
verses.niv: 58 "I tell you the truth," Jesus answered, "before Abraham was born, I am!"

verses.esv: 15 For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathize with our weaknesses, but one who in every respect has been tempted as we are, yet without sin.
verses.kjv: 15 For we have not an high priest which cannot be touched with the feeling of our infirmities; but was in all points tempted like as we are, yet without sin.
verses.niv: 15 For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathize with our weaknesses, but we have one who has been tempted in every way, just as we are--yet was without sin.

verses.esv: 30 I and the Father are one.”
verses.kjv: 30 I and my Father are one.
verses.niv: 30 I and the Father are one."

verses.esv:
8 But of the Son he says,

  “Your throne, O God, is forever and ever,
    the scepter of uprightness is the scepter of your kingdom.
verses.kjv: 8 But unto the Son he saith, Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: a sceptre of righteousness is the sceptre of thy kingdom.
verses.niv: 8 But about the Son he says, "Your throne, O God, will last for ever and ever, and righteousness will be the scepter of your kingdom.

verses.esv: 52 And Jesus increased in wisdom and in stature and in favor with God and man.
verses.kjv: 52 And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.
verses.niv: 52 And Jesus grew in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.

verses.kjv: 7 For many deceivers are entered into the world, who confess not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh. This is a deceiver and an antichrist.
verses.niv: 1 The elder,

verses.esv: 28 Thomas answered him, “My Lord and my God!”
verses.kjv: 28 And Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.
verses.niv: 28 Thomas said to him, "My Lord and my God!"

verses.esv: 6 Jesus said to him, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
verses.kjv: 6 Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.
verses.niv: 6 Jesus answered, "I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.

verses.esv: 2 By this you know the Spirit of God: every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is from God,
verses.kjv: 2 Hereby know ye the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesseth that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God:
verses.niv: 2 This is how you can recognize the Spirit of God: Every spirit that acknowledges that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is from God,

verses.esv: 13 waiting for our blessed hope, the appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ,
verses.kjv: 13 Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;
verses.niv: 13 while we wait for the blessed hope--the glorious appearing of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ,

verses.esv: 19 For in him all the fullness of God was pleased to dwell,
verses.kjv: 19 For it pleased the Father that in him should all fulness dwell;
verses.niv: 19 For God was pleased to have all his fullness dwell in him,

verses.esv: 28 After this, Jesus, knowing that all was now finished, said (to fulfill the Scripture), “I thirst.”
verses.kjv: 28 After this, Jesus knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, saith, I thirst.
verses.niv: 28 Later, knowing that all was now completed, and so that the Scripture would be fulfilled, Jesus said, "I am thirsty."

verses.esv: 4 But when the fullness of time had come, God sent forth his Son, born of woman, born under the law,
verses.kjv: 4 But when the fulness of the time was come, God sent forth his Son, made of a woman, made under the law,
verses.niv: 4 But when the time had fully come, God sent his Son, born of a woman, born under law,

verses.esv: 24 God raised him up, loosing the pangs of death, because it was not possible for him to be held by it.
verses.kjv: 24 Whom God hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.
verses.niv: 24 But God raised him from the dead, freeing him from the agony of death, because it was impossible for death to keep its hold on him.

verses.esv: 1:1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. 2 He was in the beginning with God. 3 All things were made through him, and without him was not any thing made that was made.
verses.kjv: 1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. 2 The same was in the beginning with God. 3 All things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.
verses.niv: 1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. 2 He was with God in the beginning. 3 Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made.

verses.esv: 3 He is the radiance of the glory of God and the exact imprint of his nature, and he upholds the universe by the word of his power. After making purification for sins, he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high,
verses.kjv: 3 Who being the brightness of his glory, and the express image of his person, and upholding all things by the word of his power, when he had by himself purged our sins, sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high;
verses.niv: 3 The Son is the radiance of God's glory and the exact representation of his being, sustaining all things by his powerful word. After he had provided purification for sins, he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven.

verses.esv: 3 For God has done what the law, weakened by the flesh, could not do. By sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and for sin, he condemned sin in the flesh,
verses.kjv: 3 For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:
verses.niv: 3 For what the law was powerless to do in that it was weakened by the sinful nature, God did by sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful man to be a sin offering. And so he condemned sin in sinful man,

verses.esv: 5 And now, Father, glorify me in your own presence with the glory that I had with you before the world existed.
verses.kjv: 5 And now, O Father, glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was.
verses.niv: 5 And now, Father, glorify me in your presence with the glory I had with you before the world began.

verses.esv: 17 Therefore he had to be made like his brothers in every respect, so that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in the service of God, to make propitiation for the sins of the people.
verses.kjv: 17 Wherefore in all things it behoved him to be made like unto his brethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make reconciliation for the sins of the people.
verses.niv: 17 For this reason he had to be made like his brothers in every way, in order that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in service to God, and that he might make atonement for the sins of the people.

verses.esv:
30 I and the Father are one.”

31 The Jews picked up stones again to stone him. 32 Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good works from the Father; for which of them are you going to stone me?” 33 The Jews answered him, “It is not for a good work that we are going to stone you but for blasphemy, because you, being a man, make yourself God.”
verses.kjv: 30 I and my Father are one. 31 Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him. 32 Jesus answered them, Many good works have I shewed you from my Father; for which of those works do ye stone me? 33 The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.
verses.niv: 30 I and the Father are one." 31 Again the Jews picked up stones to stone him, 32 but Jesus said to them, "I have shown you many great miracles from the Father. For which of these do you stone me?" 33 "We are not stoning you for any of these," replied the Jews, "but for blasphemy, because you, a mere man, claim to be God."
